intro: Calcitrapa iberica, commonly known as the Iberian calcitrapa, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and Portugal. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in Mediterranean climates. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
